ygData.subject: Re: Lava & Corpses was Bard Handicap of Sorts
ygData.msgSnippet: This happened to me before aswell. My friend died in Lava and I used locate corpse, it pointed me in the direction of the Lavafall (which I didn t know was
ygData.messageBody:
This happened to me before aswell. My friend died in Lava and I used locate
corpse, it pointed me in the direction of the Lavafall (which I didn't know
was there at the time. I got a Levitate (so did he) and went in, went over
the lava fall and tried to locate the corpse, nothing......

I ended up going in to Sol B, I shit myself (I was level 27) and zoned
back, tried to go back the way I came and couldn't get up the lava fall, I
was really shitting it now, went back and had to go the Sol B way. So I
zoned in and after burning my ass numerous times I was left with just over
1 bub health. From the top of the lava there was a large cavernous area and
in the middle on a raised island was a platform with people on, I floated
across and landed with a group of 6 level 45's+ they healed me up and
showed me the way out. I was soooo relieved when I was out of there.

My friend ended up getting a GM to get his corpse for him.

Madagan, Bard of 30 songs - Veeshan




"Daniel P. Sniderman" <fuzzbone@...> on 07/12/99 16:54:02

Please respond to eqbards@onelist.com

To: eqbards@onelist.com
cc: (bcc: John Senior/M&G)
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Lava & Corpses was Bard Handicap of Sorts




From: "Daniel P. Sniderman" <fuzzbone@...>

The sequence of events for me - I fell in lava right near the entrance
(from Lavastorm). Given the number of hit points a 29 bard has - and the
lava doing damage in 56 increments - I realized I had a good amount of
time - and tried to climb out.

I didn't realize this wasn't possible - and got myself in deep (nice
pun
there <g>). There is a "Lavafall" (waterfall type thingy) that you can't
climb out. Right past there is a zone to Sol-B.

My situation was that my Druid helper died because our levitations wore
off. Being the selfless type - he renewed mine before his - and
subsequently died when his fizzled. I figured I could "safely" zone to B
because I had a freshly renewed Levitate and would have plenty of time to
zone back if I had no better luck getting our of the lava in B.

When I got to B - I can't remember exactly the layout (first time I was
there anyhow) but there's like a big cavernous area - so with levitate it
was pretty easy to get to solid ground.

As far as your question - the zone from Sol-B to Sol-A is already lava
-
so you'd already have to have fell into lava in Sol-B to zone through Lava
to Sol-A...

Slyde


----- Original Message -----
From: James Schuldes <jgs@...>
To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
Sent: Tuesday, December 07, 1999 10:31 AM
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Lava & Corpses was Bard Handicap of Sorts


> From: James Schuldes <jgs@...>
>
<snip>
> p.s. some one mentioned that you can zone out from the lava pool into
Sol-b?
> Does that mean that if you were to zone from sol-b you would end up in
Lava
> if you were not levi'd when you zoned? Like someone could zone out of
sol-b
> in panic and die in the lava?
>
